TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IContextualFeatureFilter`1<TContext> implements class Microsoft.FeatureManagement.IFeatureFilterMetadata
Public Interface IContextualFeatureFilter(Of TContext) Implements IFeatureFilterMetadata

Docs.summary: A filter that can be used to determine whether some criteria is met to enable a feature. A feature filter is free to use any criteria available, such as process state or request content. Feature filters can be registered for a given feature and if any feature filter evaluates to true, that feature will be considered enabled. A contextual feature filter can take advantage of contextual data passed in from callers of the feature management system. A contextual feature filter will only be executed if a context that is assignable from TContext is available.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<bool> EvaluateAsync (Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilterEvaluationContext featureFilterContext, TContext appContext);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<bool> EvaluateAsync(class Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilterEvaluationContext featureFilterContext, !TContext appContext) cil managed
Public Function EvaluateAsync (featureFilterContext As FeatureFilterEvaluationContext, appContext As TContext) As Task(Of Boolean)

Docs.param: A feature filter evaluation context that contains information that may be needed to evaluate the filter. This context includes configuration, if any, for this filter for the feature being evaluated.
A context defined by the application that is passed in to the feature management system to provide contextual information for evaluating a feature's state.
Docs.summary: Evaluates the feature filter to see if the filter's criteria for being enabled has been satisfied.
Docs.returns: True if the filter's criteria has been met, false otherwise.
